I* GENERAL STATEMENT
Herewith the requests of the National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters to the Fund for Adult Education for the calendar year 1954. In most
cases these proposals are substantially as presented in earlier communications
and requests (May 20, August 28, September 30, October 13 and October 20). The
present reouest therefore can be considered as consolidated and definitive, follow¬
ing consultation of the NAEB Directors and Executive Committee as well as the Region
VI and National Conventions.
II. REQUESTS AND EXPLANATIONS
a.
1. Technical and Placement! In conferences of representatives of the t'AEB
with representatives of the FAE, ETRC, JCET and NCCET, it was universally
agreed that certain operational needs, particularly of new educational
television stations, require urgent attention. The request below therefore
only places in more specific written form the results of discussions already
held.
